intro: Weinmannia cochabambensis, commonly known as the Cochabamba weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Weinmanniaceae. It is native to the Andean region of Bolivia, specifically the Cochabamba Department. This shrub or small tree typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in cloud forests or paramo ecosystems. Its leaves are usually alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive, often lobed shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale in color, and it is known for its ecological importance in its native habitat.
